title: L-Cat kickers trim Blackhawks, 3-1
text:
L-Cat kickers trim Blackhawks, 3-1 
A shorthanded Fort Atkinson boys soccer team fell 3-1 to Lake Mills on Saturday at Jones Dairy Farm Stadium. 
The game originally was scheduled to be played earlier in the season, but had to be rescheduled due to bad weather. 
Goals from Zach Runte and Gerardo Guardado and a penalty kick from Michael Wilke was enough to overcome a second half own goal from the L-Cats. 
“They’re set up to be a very good team and they’ve had a fair amount of success this year,” said Fort Atkinson head coach Kent Lovejoy. “I thought we were pretty competitive with them and Lake Mills this year has a really solid team. On our end we did something we hadn’t done all year, we double man marked. We played a 3-3-2 with a double man mark on their strikers and it worked for the most part.” 
The Blackhawks (3-14-0) had some scheduling conflicts with players as well as some injuries and were only able to dress 15 players. That paired with some calls that went against Fort, like Wilke’s penalty kick in the first half, it was too much to overcome for Fort. 
Freshman Javi Meza helped put Fort on the board, forcing an own goal with a good play down the wing, cutting the ball back and taking a shot before a poor clearance from a Lake Mills’ defender put the ball in the net in the first half. 
Fort wraps up the regular season this week, taking on Monroe on the road on Tuesday before heading home on Thursday to face Hartford. Tuesday’s game is at 5 p.m. while Thursday’s will be played at 7 p.m.
